docs.abstract: Thirteen energy companies gathered in New York City to pledge action on climate change, though many of their ideas would perpetuate the use of oil and gas.
docs.snippet: Thirteen energy companies gathered in New York City to pledge action on climate change, though many of their ideas would perpetuate the use of oil and gas.
docs.lead_paragraph: From the deck of a boat in New York harbor, the chief executive of Equinor squinted toward a stretch of sea where his oil company will soon build a giant wind farm. “We are doing all we can” to fight climate change, said the executive, Eldar Saetre.

headline.main: Oil Giants, Under Fire From Climate Activists and Investors, Mount a Defense
headline.print_headline: Oil Giants, on Defense, Offer Few Climate Fixes

docs.abstract: The former Exxon  chief executive Rex Tillerson  testified Wednesday in a case that accuses the company of committing shareholder fraud over climate change.
docs.snippet: The former Exxon  chief executive Rex Tillerson  testified Wednesday in a case that accuses the company of committing shareholder fraud over climate change.
docs.lead_paragraph: The shareholder fraud lawsuit brought by the New York attorney general against Exxon Mobil has entered its second week, and on Wednesday a star witness took the stand: Rex Tillerson, the company’s former chief executive and a former secretary of state in the Trump administration.

headline.main: Rex Tillerson Testifies in Exxon Climate Change Case
headline.print_headline: Tillerson Parries New York In Exxon Climate Case

docs.abstract: Millions of people have a stake in corporate America through mutual funds. But you may be surprised by how those funds are voting on your behalf.
docs.snippet: Millions of people have a stake in corporate America through mutual funds. But you may be surprised by how those funds are voting on your behalf.
docs.lead_paragraph: When somebody offers something for nothing, I don’t cheer. I reach in my pocket to see if my wallet is still there.

headline.main: Want a Bigger Say on Corporate Behavior? Move Your Money
headline.print_headline: Want a Bigger Say? Move Your Money

docs.abstract: The money could make the country more resilient — if it doesn’t just end up causing more conflict and corruption.
docs.snippet: The money could make the country more resilient — if it doesn’t just end up causing more conflict and corruption.
docs.lead_paragraph: MAPUTO, Mozambique — On Tuesday evening, five days after Cyclone Idai hit central Mozambique and the rains started, thousands of survivors were still stranded, waiting to be rescued from trees or the roofs of houses.

headline.main: Can Exxon Mobil Protect Mozambique From Climate Change?

docs.abstract: Algae are tiny, but potentially mighty. They grow in saltwater and can produce bio-oil that one day could fuel our transportation needs. See how ExxonMobil is researching this renewable fuel.
docs.snippet: Algae are tiny, but potentially mighty. They grow in saltwater and can produce bio-oil that one day could fuel our transportation needs. See how ExxonMobil is researching this renewable fuel.

headline.main: Algae May Be Small — But Its Impact Could Be Big

docs.abstract: An arbitration panel sided with the company 11 years after Hugo Chávez expropriated several of its oil projects. Now the problem is trying to collect.
docs.snippet: An arbitration panel sided with the company 11 years after Hugo Chávez expropriated several of its oil projects. Now the problem is trying to collect.
docs.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — ConocoPhillips won a ruling on Wednesday that says it is entitled to more than $2 billion from Venezuela’s state oil company over the country’s expropriation of several oil projects more than a decade ago.

headline.main: ConocoPhillips Wins $2 Billion Ruling Over Venezuelan Seizure
headline.print_headline: Panel Awards Energy Firm $2 Billion From Venezuela

keywords.value: International Center for Settlement of Investment Disputes

docs.abstract: After an investigation of more than three years, the state's attorney general has sued Exxon Mobil, accusing it of downplaying the risks of global warming to its business.
docs.snippet: After an investigation of more than three years, the state's attorney general has sued Exxon Mobil, accusing it of downplaying the risks of global warming to its business.
docs.lead_paragraph: New York’s attorney general sued Exxon Mobil on Wednesday, claiming the company defrauded shareholders by downplaying the expected risks of climate change to its business.

headline.main: New York Sues Exxon Mobil, Saying It Deceived Shareholders on Climate Change
headline.print_headline: Lawsuit Says Exxon Misled Investors on Climate

docs.abstract: How scientists are tapping algae and plant waste to fuel a sustainable energy future.
docs.snippet: How scientists are tapping algae and plant waste to fuel a sustainable energy future.

headline.main: The Future of Energy? It May Come From Where You Least Expect

docs.abstract: A ship contracted by Exxon Mobil suspended operations after it was approached by a Venezuelan navy vessel in a renewal of a century-old border dispute.
docs.snippet: A ship contracted by Exxon Mobil suspended operations after it was approached by a Venezuelan navy vessel in a renewal of a century-old border dispute.
docs.lead_paragraph: An oil-exploration ship contracted by Exxon Mobil suspended operations off the coast of Guyana over the weekend after it was approached by a Venezuelan navy vessel in a renewal of a century-old border dispute.

headline.main: Venezuela Navy Interrupts Oil Exploration Off Guyana
headline.print_headline: Confrontation Off Guyana Halts Oil Hunt

docs.abstract: ExxonMobil and IBM reach for the cloud to bring convenience and extra security to the pump.
docs.snippet: ExxonMobil and IBM reach for the cloud to bring convenience and extra security to the pump.

headline.main: What Can Gas Stations Teach Us About Digital Transformation?
